trans-unit.source: Provides the same functionality as <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref>, but also derives from <xref href="System.MarshalByRefObject"></xref> so that it can be instantiated in its own app domain.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.AppDomainIsolatedTask"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.AppDomainIsolatedTask"></xref> class and allows derived <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref> classes to register their resources.
The task resources.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.AppDomainIsolatedTask"></xref> class and allows derived <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref> classes to register their resources, as well as provide a prefix for composing help keywords from string resource names.
If the prefix is an empty string, then string resource names will be used verbatim as Help keywords.
For an example of how the prefix is used, see the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper.LogErrorWithCodeFromResources%2A> method.
The task resources.
The Help keyword prefix.
Gets or sets the build engine interface that is available to tasks.
The build engine automatically sets this property to allow tasks to call back into it.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine"></xref> that is available to tasks.
Runs the task.
This method must be implemented by the derived class.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if successful; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the prefix that is used to compose Help keywords from string resource names.
If a task does not have help keywords associated with its messages, it can ignore this property or set it to null.
If the prefix is set to an empty string, then string resource names will be used verbatim as help keywords.
For an example of how this prefix is used, see the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper.LogErrorWithCodeFromResources%2A> method.
A <xref:System.String> that is used to compose Help keywords.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a host object instance that is associated with the derived <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref>.
The build engine sets this property if the host IDE has associated a host object with this particular task.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskHost"></xref> host object instance that is associated with the derived <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref>.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gives tasks infinite lease time.
Otherwise, a limited lease of 5 minutes will result; and task instances can expire if they take a long time to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to specify an infinite lifetime.
Gets an instance of a task logging helper object that contains task logging methods.
A <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper"></xref> that contains task logging methods.
Gets or sets culture-specific resources of the derived <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref>.
Derived classes should register their resources either during construction, or through this property, if they have localized strings.
A <xref:System.Resources.ResourceManager> that is a culture-specific resource of the derived <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref>.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
